results.title: Glass
results.brief_description: Portrays without commentary the deft craftsmanship of glass blowers, highlighting the artistry and individuality of their work. Contrasts this with machines which produce bottles and glass jars automatically.

results.title: Glasgow 1980
results.creator_credit: Oscar Marzaroli, City of Glascow, Films of Scotland and Ogam Films
results.brief_description: The urban renewal of Glasgow. The biggest urban renewal in Europe. A 20 year program begun in 1960 involving 550 miles or one twelth of the City area. Shows what has been achieved and what will be achieved by 1980. Editing by Bill Forsyth. Narrated by Michael Harrigan.

results.title: Glaciation
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready, Frank Spiller, Rene Jodoin and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Today only remnants remains of the great ice sheets that once covered North America, but the glaciers found in the Canadian Artic and mountain regions are still one of the most unusual elements of our natural environment and an amazing repository of geological history. This colour film, suitable for the classroom, shows the surprising life and activity of glaciers

results.title: Giving a shop demonstration
results.brief_description: An example of good teaching practise in the school workshop and materials are assembled in preparation for the class; a demonstration by the instructor precedes practical work by students; the instruction demonstrates and explains proper methods to be used; questions are asked by the teacher and the students during the course of the work.

results.title: Give us this day
results.creator_credit: Phil Mulloy, Simon Hartog, Arts Council of Great Britain and Spectre Productions
results.brief_description: In 1910 Robert Noonan, whose pen-name was Robert Tressell, finished his book “The Ragged Trousered Philanthropist” and wrote in the title page that it was “the story of 12 months in hell told by one of the damned”. This fully dramatised film is based on the fragments of information known about his life, his writing and the political events of the 9 years he spent in England.

results.title: Give us a smile
results.brief_description: A lively presentation, in animated form, protesting against a range of sexist attitudes maintained by our society. For example, shows the role played by advertising and pornography in these processes and records the efforts of women who fight back against such violence.

results.title: Give trees a chance: the story of Terania Creek
results.creator_credit: Jeni Kendell and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Terania Creek is the site of a threatened rainforest. Presents the stand taken by conservationists against the Forestry Commission and police to try to save the last of the virgin rainforest at Terania Creek and to argue for an environmental impact study. Narrated by Jack Thompson.

results.title: Give them a chance: we very much regret
results.creator_credit: Michael Palmer, Stanley Wright, Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and Rank Screen Services
results.brief_description: This film was made in a refugee camp in Europe to show conditions in which the refugees have been living for many years. It depicts, as an almost everyday incident, the bitter disappointment felt by a refugee family when their application to go overseas is turned down. Includes a statement by the High Commissioner for Refugees on the efforts made by his office to clear the camps in Europe by the end of 1960.
